intro: Oreodaphne tampicensis, commonly known as the Tampic palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Oreodaphne tampicensis is often found growing in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
